text: Kevin Rafferty (1948 - July 2, 2020) was an American documentary cinematographer, director, and producer. He was best known for his 1982 documentary The Atomic Cafe. He was born in New York City. He was a mentor to filmmaker Michael Moore and helped him during the production of Roger & Me in 1989. Rafferty was a nephew of First Lady Barbara Bush, and a cousin of President George W. Bush.Goodman, Amy.Democracy Now, "Michael Moore on His Life, His Films and His Activism," September 6, 2010.
